inn1.comm: starts off around the wicket but strays a little too straight. No turn as Kusal goes back and clips past midwicket
tossed up outside off, Lahiru is forward and drives to long-off
was setting up for a flick, but then saw this was bowled a little shorter and blocks

quicker and flatter on middle, Kusal was playing around his front pad. Big shout for leg before as the ball balloons to the slip fielder, who dives to his left but can't cling on. Think there was an inside edge there
length ball on middle and off, pushed into the covers
defends down the pitch after lunging forward to smother any spin
curls in as he pitches this up on off stump. Lahiru manages to stay behind it
fuller and on the stumps, defended to mid-on and he looked far more solid than the last ball
too far outside off stump to bother Lahiru into playing
leans into this extra cover drive. Times it very well as he reaches nicely forward and puts away the full length ball with a bit of width outside off
length ball, pushed across him. Does not play
fullish and outside off, strides forward and defends into the covers
probes away in the channel outside off, Lahiru gets to practice his leave again
flighted on middle and leg, nudges to midwicket from the crease
shortish and he was making some room to cut. But the ball sneaks under his bat. Worrying signs?
worked away to midwicket, but can't beat the man
goes wide of the crease, but his length is poor. Kusal rocks back and this time nails the cut. Proper bounce on that and he thumps it behind point
lunges forward to try and get to the pitch, but this one goes straight on and gets the inside edge as he defends
prefers the safety of this crease this time as he defends the length ball
fullish and slid just wide of off stump, left alone
back of a length on and around off stump, defended into the covers
very loose. Tempts him outside off and he threw his bat at it with a nothing sort of shot. Angled bat offered to try and punch into the covers, beaten
plays late and close to his body as he opens the face again. Runs it down, but only as far as slip
length ball outside off, defended off the back foot. That didn't bounce very much at all
fullish, but he's on the pads and he's far more comfortable there, clipping it away to long leg
good length ball, just outside off. Kept out
looks to whip the length ball sliding into him away behind square. Gets it off the pads though
fullish and keeps it tight on the stumps, defended
makes his own room and slaps it behind point. It was a tiny bit short but that was enough for him to take full toll. Struck that so cleanly
was wondering when he would do that. Charges Hafeez., but can only push it back to the bowler
flighted just outside off, lunges forward and defends
steers this away to deep third man as he sees this with a bit of room outside off. Uses Gul's pace quite nicely
punched into the covers even though there wasn't too much room on offer. Sways his upper body a little leg side of the ball to get some leverage into the shot, but he can't place it in the gap

jags back in sharply and he was in no position to counter it. Gul thinks he has his man, but the umpire thinks it might go over the stumps. Kusal was setting up for the cut again as he made some room, he this hits the deck and ducks inward. His bat was too slow coming down. Saved if only by a whisker
shortish and in the channel, Kusal stands up and blocks
is on the back foot and uses hard hands to defend into the covers
fuller and outside off stump, Kusal is forward and drives on the up but only as far as the cover field
tossed up on off stump, no troubles for Lahiru's straight bat
shortens the length which allows him to go back and punch just wide of mid-off
chips down the track and having reached the pitch, pushes to long-on
straightens a bit as Lahiru covers his stumps and defends under his eyes

lovely timing through the covers from Lahiru again! It was hit on the up, but with so little spin on offer he basically treated this as a medium pace delivery and hit through the line off the front foot
comes forward and defends the flighted ball on off stump
pushed into the covers, but there wasn't much footwork there. Think that went off the outside half of the blade too. Good areas from Gul

carts this away over wide long-on. Kusal has had enough of scratching around as he goes after this length ball outside off. Full swing of the arms carries this through to the boundary. Didn't get all of it, though

he has his man this time. Edged through to the keeper! The cross-seamer generates a bit more bounce and the angle away from him is just perfect. And that is enough to snare the outside edge of Kusal's poking bat. It was in that length where he was still wondering whether to go forward or back even as he nicks off. Easy catch to Akmal behind the stumps
length ball outside off, calmly allowed through to the keeper
full and wide outside off, Sanga leans forward and threads it through the covers. Effortlessly done and yet he looks so elegant
fullish and around the off stump, Sanga is forward and his defence is solid
very full and just a touch outside off, Kusal is forward and pushes into the covers
back of a length on off stump, blocked towards mid-on
shuffles to cover his stumps and punches to point off the back foot as Junaid goes shortish and outside off
length ball in the channel again, he pokes at it with an angled bat again and gets an inside edge.
draws him forward this time and Lahiru isn't afraid to drive on the up. Short cover is on hand to stop it though. But the parry is enough to sneak a single
full and wide outside off, this time Sanga cannot time the cover drive. Guess this pitch really is slow
beats short cover, but hasn't timed it enough to evade mid-off. It was full and on off stump, driven off the front foot
shortish and angled across him, Lahiru opens the face to exploit the gap between point and cover
good length ball probing just outside off, Sanga plays late and guides it behind point

loads of effort into this one and it shows as this quick bouncer beats Akmal behind the stumps even with him leaping as high as he could. Sanga had no troubles evading it though and then sneaks a single. Impressive height to the short ball
fullish and straight, Lahiru turns it away to square leg

pierces the gap on the off side again, maybe those comparisons with Sanga are not totally unfounded. It was the cross-seamed delivery again, but this one is a bit tame. Lahiru is forward and exploits the room outside. Flayed off the front foot
fullish on middle and leg, nudges it to the right of midwicket. Nicely placed
flighted on middle, driven to long-off
skips down the track, but the bowler is wise to it as he shortens the length. Defended
flighted on off stump, easily pushed to the man at long-off again
fullish on off stump, Lahiru is forward and tries to force it through the covers. No such luck
so he plays with softer hands and angles the bat, still can't beat cover
bit short and seems to have bounced on the batsman a bit more. Lahiru is back and has to uses his wrists to keep it down
creams it, but cannot beat cover. Gee, that man's been busy in the last few balls. Full and wide outside off and he climbed into it.
walks at him and nudges this length ball to the left of mid-on
finds the gap behind point! Affords a bit of width and Lahiru is only too happy to get on the front foot and slice it away. Too well timed for deep third man to bother
length ball on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
short and just outside off, Lahiru pulls to deep square leg. Didn't go all out on it though
good length ball just outside off, guided in front of point
carves the length ball to point. Held this one back to prevent Lahiru from lunging forward
nice and tight on middle, and the length is very good too. Makes the batsman force the pace as he hits down to long-on
skips down the track and lofts over wide mid-on. Hafeez's stranglehold is not working here. No turn to worry him and Sanga heaves it away into the leg side
tossed up on off stump, driven to long-on
punched through the covers but there is protection in the deep
flighted on middle, pushed to long-on. Sanga is now 12000-plus while playing in Sri Lankan colours

the keeper is vociferous in his appeal and the bowler joins in later, but the umpire is not so keen. Sanga was skipping down the track and was looking to flick it off his pads. No bat involved though as it strikes pad and the back foot and goes through to Akmal
fullish and just a touch wide off off, defended
dances down the track and just met the ball with a straight bat. That's all he did. Wasn't to the pitch of it but it doesn't matter on this pitch.
walks at him this time, but Junaid manages to angle this in on a good length and gives no room. Sanga gets an inside edge onto pad
worked away wide of mid-on as this was shortish and outside off. Used the crease nicely as he moved across outside off
room outside off, but the field is set to protect the bowler erring short and wide. Hit uppishly but in the gap and it finds its way to the sweeper
back of a length just outside off, Lahiru eases it to the third man boundary but the fielder manages to run around and keep it inside the playing field
bit too straight was this length ball and he whips it to deep square leg
magnificent strike, for no runs though! Strong stride forward to this fuller delivery just outside off. Driven with complete authority to mid-off
plays too early and gets a leading edge into the covers. Length ball on middle and leg forces the mistake
length ball worked away into the leg side, but can't find the gap
looks like he's hurrying the batsmen here. It was just short of a good length and seemed to skid onto him quicker. Lahiru keeps it out, but only just about
presents an open face but plays close to his body to guide the shortish delivery to point

eases it through point and cover. It was full and wide outside off and Sanga needs no second invitation for that cover drive of his. Sweeper mops up but they sneak a couple. Lahiru was struggling though
walks at him and nudges it just in front of point. Another risky single but they hustle through.
fullish on and around off stump, driven solidly to mid-off
shortish, but this goes down the leg side. Sanga allows it through to the keeper knowing this would be wided
pushed to the sweeper as this is on a length with a bit of room outside off
think that stayed low, but Lahiru controlled it well. Clips the length ball angled into him to long leg
clipped to the left of mid-on as this is bowled shortish and on the pads. Only rose as high as the batsman's knees though
another harmless little whip to long leg as he goes short and on leg stump again. Wrong line to bowl with a 7-2 off side field
too straight again and Sanga clips it to deep square leg. No risk, easy run and that's the fifty partnership
perfectly placed! He waited so long that the ball was almost past him before he brought the horizontal bat down on it to give it direction and power. No chance for deep third man
back of a length on middle and off, defended

shortish and on leg stump, not quite the best place to bowl considering his field and he's been reminded of that as Lahiru swivels on the back foot and pulls just behind square leg ump and that will be drinks
good length ball outside off, punched to short cover
steers this back of a length delivery outside off to point
mid-on tries his hardest but Sanga's timing is just too good. Chips down the track and he looks perfectly poised to play this straight drive to the left of the stumps
goes short and Sanga ducks under it. But it is just a touch down the leg side
tucks him up with a length ball and Sanga clips towards midwicket and sets off straight away
digs it in again, this time well enough outside off. But Lahiru doesn't mind pulling it to square leg.
fullish on off stump, pushed down the ground but the bowler hurries across to stop it
lovely loop to this one on off stump, Lahiru strides forward and drives to long-off
holds it back to Sanga, possibly worried about him dancing down. Guided to the sweeper
flights it nicely to Lahiru, who pushes forward and finds the gap in the covers
leans into this as Ajmal tosses it up outside off, driven to long-off
lunges forward and opens the face to thread this through point and cover
a run off every ball of the over as this is pushed to long-off

big shot for leg before! Was terribly close too, but this might have pitched outside leg. Yes. Skids on to Sanga who was late on his shot, which was coming down around his front pad. Would have crashed into the stumps, but it doesn't matter
length ball, whipped away through square leg to raise his first fifty since last July. Good pitch to bat and he's taking advantage
moved outside off to nudge this away off his hips. Bhatti's pace does the rest. This doesn't even come off the bat but races away very fine
slower ball on leg stump, Sanga waits and clips it to the rather square long leg
this is nice and full on the stumps. Lahiru keeps it out and inspects his bat. That had a bit of heat
back of a length, tucks it away off his hips to long leg
lunges forward a bit too soon and Ajmal pulls his length back. Goes through with the shot as he opens the face to point
how did that miss? He has misread the doosra as he goes forward to drive loosely. The ball sneaks between bat and pad and it wanders past the keeper as well. What a delivery!
eased into the leg side as this is tossed up on middle
good length ball on off, defended off the back foot
goes on the front foot to get to the pitch and drives to deep cover
tossed up outside off, Lahiru goes forward and drives to long-off
starts off with a full toss outside off, Lahiru can only bunt it back to the bowler

this one stays rather low but Lahiru shuffles across to his off stump and tickles it to the long leg boundary. Could have been plumb in front had he not got bat to that, but to his credit, he played that well
slides on with the arm as he opens the face to slice the shortish ball to point
flighted outside off as he drives to mid-off and sets off straight away and that saves him because the fielder had thrown down the stumps. Dead-eye Gul
works this away off the pads. Easy single behind square leg
flighted outside off, strides forward and drives into the covers
flighted on middle, Sanga is forward and blocks
hint of turn as this is on a length on middle, Sanga pushes to long-on
edged, but no slip Lovely flight from Ajmal as he lures the batsman forward and makes him poke a little away from his body. But he doesn't have the necessary support
tossed up outside off and this was the doosra too, defended
length ball, pushes him back in his crease as he offers the straight bat
goes forward and defends into the covers
nudged away to deep square leg as this was tossed up, but a little too straight
loopy delivery outside off. Lahiru stays leg side of it and drills to the man at cover
shuffles across to try and work this from middle. Looks for the single but the man at midwicket was too quick
length ball on off stump, pushed to long-on

flighted outside off and Sanga threads it between extra cover and mid-off. Precision placement from Sanga to bring up the hundred partnership. Great effort from Gul too to keep it from hitting the ropes
goes on with the arm, no spin at all as he is forward and slices this away to deep point
length ball is driven towards cover for a single, risk-free run there
fuller and on middle stump, pushed back to the right of the bowler
plays with soft hands towards cover for a single
a touch shorter, outside off, pushed towards a shortish mid-off
eased towards mid-on for a single
waits for it to arrive, plays it late towards third man for a single
length ball, Sangakkara skips down the track and whips the ball towards deep midwicket
played off the back foot towards mid-on
lovely hit, straight over the bowler's head, two bounces to the rope, gets close to the pitch of the ball before he unleashes that shot
defended back towards the bowler
on the pads, clipped towards square leg for a single
length ball outside off, a typically elegant Sangakkara drive sends the ball racing towards the extra cover boundary
length ball outside off, slapped towards deep point for a single
length ball heading for the leg stump, thumped off the back foot towards the midwicket boundary, half-century No. 84 comes up, this man is in some form
pushed back towards the bowler
length ball, Sangakkara dances down the track and defends it
superbly done by Sangakkara, just a bit of width, he waits on the back foot, and guides that behind point for four, didn't try to muscle that one, all about placement
length ball is driven towards sweeper cover for one more, a profitable over for Sri Lanka
Afridi from round the wicket, defended to the leg side
spinning in towards middle, eased past the bowler for a single
length ball guided to long-on for one more
drops it short, spinning in towards off stump, steered towards deep backward point for two
on the pads, another easy single, to long-on this time
full toss outside off, worked towards deep point for a single
flighted just outside off, casually driven to mid-off
goes forward to this tossed up delivery on middle and leg and works it to short fine leg
bit of turn here for Hafeez but Lahiru adjusts after lunging forward. Sticks to a defensive push
swept away. This was flighted on middle and Lahiru is quickly onto it and hits it uppishly. But he knows there is no one at square leg
length ball on off stump, goes back and pushes to mid-off
flighted on off stump, drives through to long-off
starts with an offcutter which is steered towards point. Hit it soft enough to sneak a single

don't bother running. This was overpitched outside off and Sanga dismisses it over mid-off. Lovely balance to enable the stroke as he looks simply to beat the man inside the circle but with the kind of timing he has, this was always a boundary
fullish and straight, pushes to mid-on
goes around the wicket now and hits a back of a length outside off. Lahiru was a little too enthusiastic in trying to guide this away and gets an inside edge
worked away through midwicket. Anwar Ali patrols the region, substitute for Ahmed Shehzad
finds the blockhole on middle and leg, Sanga shuffles across and whips it to the right of short fine leg
goes back and punches the length ball angled into him down to long-on
flighted on off stump, goes forward and drives to long-off
flighted on off, straight bat sends the ball to long-off
fullish but Sanga prefers to go back and punches to long-off. Nimble footwork against spin takes the partnership past 150

heaved over deep midwicket, that's the first six of the match and the ninth of his career! Flighted on middle, Lahiru lunges forward and slog sweeps to great effect. Got loads of height on this, but he manages to clear the ropes as well
tossed up outside off and he helps himself to a single to long-off
back of a length and angled in on middle and leg as Gul continues around the wicket. Clipped to midwicket
fullish and just a shade outside off as Lahiru is forward and drives to long-off
bit of width outside off, but Sanga can only nudge it behind point. Didn't get it off the middle as he had hoped
fullish on off stump, he strides forward and pushes to long-off

short ball and pulled straight to midwicket. Gul strikes totally against the run of play. It was short and it had enough width to merit an aggressive stroke, but his balance was more on the front foot which foils his timing
eased away into the covers as he gets forward to this fuller delivery
flighted just outside off, draws Mahela forward as he blocks
gets a bit of drift into the batsman. Mahela comes forward and defends to long-off
goes back as he nudges into the midwicket region

width outside off and he slams it over mid-off. He's racing towards that century. Made a bit of room outside leg and swung with the confidence of a man who's got a lot more than his lone ODI ton thus far
length ball on middle and leg, nudged to midwicket
another shortish ball on the stumps, punched to the left of long-on to keep strike
fullish and just outside off, Lahiru plays with soft hands towards point
he's disappointed at not beating the man at point. Shortish and allows him to cut it behind square, but Shehzad does well as he dives to his right
fullish on off stump, Mahela pushes back to the bowler
length ball on off stump, stays in his crease and eases it with the open blade to point
quick single into the covers as Mahela comes forward to the length ball and dabs it with soft hands

a lovely cover drive takes him through to a second ODI century. That drink is going to taste so much better now. Width offered outside off as he leans forward and caresses it through the gap, which was rather hard to find with the field up
tossed up outside off, Lahiru's straight bat guides this to long-off
tight line on off stump as he lures Mahela forward but that defensive bat is just as solid as ever
sliding down leg as Mahela keeps his front leg out of the way and clips through midwicket
good length ball on leg stump, pushed to long-on
tossed up on off stump, Mahela blocks into the off side
pushes it through on middle and leg, Mahela plants his front leg across outside off and nudges it to long leg
flatter delivery on the pads, Mahela clips it to deep square leg

off stump is knocked back! Was he playing inside the line there? Yep, but that was because Ajmal gets this fuller delivery to turn just enough. It was a loose drive taking the bat away from his body as he stayed rooted outside leg stump and perishes. Ajmal has his hands raised in triumph.
flighted on off stump, defended off the front foot
more turn as he bowls this just a bit shortish and on the stumps. Mathews makes room and cuts to point
flighted on middle, turns it away to midwicket
lovely line as he targets off stump. Mathews is forward and pushes back to the bowler
quick and flat and the off stump was in considerable danger as Mahela made room and was trying to late cut it away. Has to hurry his stroke but manages to keep it out
fullish on middle and leg, Mahela clips it into the midwicket region
flighted and angled in on middle, Mathews keeps his front leg out of the way as he defends
whip of the wrists sends the flighted ball on off stump to deep midwicket
skips down the track as he defends down the pitch.
short on middle and off, Mahela rocks back and pulls towards midwicket. Sohaib Maqsood has a lot of ground to cover from deep square leg and he fumbles on the boundary. What was two becomes three
swept away to  deep square leg. Solid stroke as this is flighted on off stump
too close for that shot and Mathews gets away with it. Quicker delivery as he targets the top of off stump. Mathews stays leg side and guides to short third man
whips to midwicket as this is flighted but on the pads
holds this one back as he looks to tuck the batsman up on middle and leg, so Mathews moves outside off and slog sweeps him with considerable power.
charges him and deposits the ball over long-on! Didn't quite reach the pitch, but that only enabled him to get further leverage on the stroke as he let his arms swing free
can only turn this length ball to midwicket
fullish and drifting down the pads, comes to him a little quicker as Mahela works it away behind square leg
flighted on middle and off, Mathews is forward and clips it through square leg region
drops short of deep square leg as Mahela indulges in a slog sweep. Wasn't all that full and he got it off the toe
goes back as he pushes the length ball to long-off

the star man does it again! Chops onto his off stump! Looks for that late cut once again, but this one comes in at him. Mahela is thoroughly deceived as he gets a thick nick onto off stump. Misbah is grinning the largest I have ever seen him
targets leg stump and Thisara has little trouble clipping through square leg
nicely tossed up on middle, Thisara is forward and clips behind square leg
quicker, fuller delivery on middle and off. Turned away to midwicket again
manages to nudge this to the right of midwicket to sneak a single
length ball on off stump, Thisara shuffles across and clips between midwicket and mid-on who are both back so Ajmal has to run after it himself. Does well to keep it to a single
short and it has just enough room for Mathews to cut behind point. There is no one in the deep over there since we are still in the powerplay. Terrific stroke
flighted on middle and off, Mathews lunges forward to defend
length ball on middle, Thisara goes back to work to midwicket
shortish and it is far too wide down the leg side. Thisara doesnt even bother
goes deep in his crease to work this length ball away to the right of short fine leg
flighted on middle, he is forward and defends softly into the covers. Good, quick single
goes a touch wide of the crease as he first this full on leg stump. Thisara sweeps it away to deep square leg
flighted on off stump, strides forward to defend
this slides in with the arm, but Mathews does well as he tickles it to short fine leg
good length ball on off stump, Mathews prefers to go back and clip into the leg side
back of a length and just outside off, punched to mid-off and they scamper through. Good urgency
full and angled across him, Thisara looks to blast that through the covers but can't connect
low full toss on middle and leg, Thisara whacks it to long-on
shortish but right over off stump. Mathews made his own room and dabs to point. Good running to take the single, and even better to steal the second as Misbah fails to back up the throw properly
fullish and he simply lofts it to the long-off boundary. Bounces just inside the advertising skirting. Lovely striking from Mathews as he came on the front foot and hit straight through the line

heaved away to deep midwicket and he has holed out! The spinners are bringing Pakistan back into this big time. Afridi exults after duping the batsman with a wrong 'un. Thisara was forced to slog against the turn and he cannot beat the man on the boundary
shortish and just outside off, punched down to long-off
chopped to short third man as this was flatter and outside off
fires this full and down the leg side. Akmal can't get across in time and they scurry through for a single before short fine mops up
gets off the mark straight away, pushed to mid-off
flighted on middle and off, Mathews defends and looks for the run but cover is too quick on it

almost found the gap between point and short third man. He had waited nicely on this shorter ball outside off but his placement is not quite up to the mark as point moves to his left and dives to keep it to none
full and just outside off, de Silva drills it to long-on
steers into the covers and he almost sold his partner out. He called for the run but came to his senses soon enough. Has a wry smile on his face as Afridi misses the stumps

this time the stumps are broken and de Silva was not even in the frame. Another yes-no situation as Mathews edges this to point. Shehzad was quick on the ball, took aim and does brilliantly. Sri Lanka are losing the plot here
back of a length and outside off, Mathews pushes to long-off
shortish and angled across him, Chandimal guides this off the back foot to point
a whip of his wrists sends this shortish ball outside off to midwicket. Loads of effort for nothing
good length ball on leg stump, clipped behind square leg
slides on with the arm as Chandimal goes back and pushes into the covers
goes down the pitch and works this flighted ball on leg stump through midwicket
bit of a misfield from Misbah, but the batsman are wary of a run-out now. Nudge to midwicket results in another dot ball
eased away behind square leg
manages to tickle it away but short fine leg hurls himself at it to keep that to a single
shortish and angled across him again, but Chandimal's wrists do excellent work. Imbues enough power into the flick to almost take it to the square leg boundary.
steered to point where he can't beat the fielder

heaved away and he's placed this immensely well. Chandimal is making a statement here as he pulls to find the boundary. He was camped on the back foot, ready to take advantage of anything even remotely short. Hit well in front of deep square leg this time
moves around the wicket and fires in a yorker on off stump, Chandimal digs it out to mid-off
brilliant yorker again, this one tailing on middle and leg. Mathews almost loses balance while he manages to push this to long-on

slower ball beats both batsman and keeper! Chandimal was looking to flick it into the leg side and was into the shot way too early. Gets an outside edge which dies on its way to the keeper who cannot stop it going to the third man boundary
good length ball, tucking him up. Mathews works it to midwicket
lap sweep earns only a single as he goes down on one knee and takes the ball on the full. The shot was on considering Ajmal's leg stump line
employs the sweep too, but this one was tossed up on off stump and he can only ease it behind square leg. Not too much power in the stroke
rocks back as he punches this shortish ball through to the sweeper
leading edge to cover! Lovely flight from Ajmal as he fools the batsman, who was on the front foot looking to clip through midwicket.

shortens the length but this was the doosra again. Chandimal does not pick it again as he looks to flick into the leg side. The outside edge wanders into the covers again and Mathews denies the single. Only three off that over
that's darn near perfect! Fires a yorker on off stump and all Mathews can do is protect his stumps
full toss on off stump, thumped wide of long-off. Managed to chip down the track and reach it before it pitched
inside edge onto pad and they scurry through for a single. This was a wide yorker and Mathews was looking to slice it through point, but doesn't succeed
walks at him and converts the yorker on middle into a low full toss. Whipped away to deep midwicket
what a shot! Mathews, you beauty! Made room for himself and he drills this low full toss over the covers. Terrific shot, inside out
guides this away to short third man as he makes a little room for himself against this shortish ball outside off
fires it in on middle, Mathews clips in front of square on the leg side
moves across to off stump and works this tossed up delivery off his pads between square leg and short fine leg
goes for the slog through midwicket but he gets more of an inside edge. Wanted two and Chandimal motors to reach his ground at the non-strikers'
doosra from Ajmal as Mathews clears his front leg and taps it behind point.
tossed up, but outside leg as Chandimal sweeps. Doesn't connect with bat but does so with the pad. So no wide either
cut to point as this is on a length and pushed across him
good length ball angled in at him. Mathews slogs for all he's worth, but only manages an inside edge to deep square leg
skips down the track and carves the low full toss to deep point. He's too disappointed on not putting that away to the boundary to realise he's got to fifty
attempts his own version of the dilscoop, but Junair was wise to it as he slows it up and bowls it wide of off stump
yorker on middle and off, Chandimal jams his bat down on it and gets an inside edge wide of mid-on
slammed through extra cover. Made some room as he came down the track and though it was the cutter, Mathews has enough room to flay it to the boundary
terrific ball to end the innings as he delivers a yorker on middle and leg. Mathews digs it out to long-on

inn2.comm: beaten firs ball! Just short of a length and outside off. Sharjeel was setting up to cut but doesn't connect
short and wide again and this time Sharjeel has nailed the cut shot but has also picked out point
tucks him up as this is on a length and on the stumps. Defended off the back foot
slides this back of a length delivery across the left-hander who refuses to play
good length ball with just the smallest hint of movement in. Sharjeel keeps it out

this is soft of a whip-pull and he's struck it extremely well! Perhaps a little too straight from Malinga and he is set up on the back foot and those powerful wrists stand him in good stead as he beats deep square leg
lovely line of attack from Lakmal as this is back of a length on off stump. Shehazad is squared up as he negotiates the outswing with a straight bat
good length ball on middle and leg, pushed to mid-on

loud, persistent appeal for leg before but the umpire is unmoved. Strikes him on the top flap of the back pad as Lakmal manages to snare some away movement off this length delivery. Shehzad is squared up again and survives. High possibly. Actually, that was clipping off stump!
fullish and outside off, Shehzad is forward and guides it point
more swing away as this is fuller on off stump, Shehzad blocks
shuffles across to defend this length ball outside off stump
nice and tight on the stumps, Sharjeel blocks down to mid-on
no feet from Sharjeel as this is fullish and fired in on off stump. Barely manages to keep it out
good length ball on middle and off, defended off the back foot. Not too convincingly though
on the pads and Shehzad enjoys an easy escape as he clips to deep square leg
angling it quite acutely in at the left-hander from around the wicket. Sharjeel covers his stumps and works it into midwicket
strides well forward to defend to short cover
pulled and it evades a leaping short midwicket. He was on the back foot in a flash and though it wasn't quite short enough, he has powered it away to the boundary
another vociferous appeal as the batsman seemed late on his shot. Lakmal gets it to move in at the batsman rather late, but he is struck too high
beaten outside off, as this too moves away outside off stump. Shehzad doesn't account for it as he goes to drive on the up.
short of a good length on off stump, Shehzad is comfortable on the back foot
good length ball, moving in at him this time. Shezhad shuffles across and is stuck on the pads. There is an appeal from the slips, but this was sliding down leg
length ball just outside off, Shehzad is stuck in his crease as he pushes to short cover
fullish on off stump, this time Sharjeel is confident enough to come forward and blocks very well
bit of width outside off and he was going a little too hard at the drive. No timing there as mid-off moves to his right to control it
slower ball from Malinga, but the batsman is wise to it. Opens the face and guides it to cover
pounds this over mid-on! Seeks the blockhole as he so often does, but Sharjeel is waiting for that length. Keeps his front foot away and lofts it purely on bottom hand strength! Incredible shot!
works the angle as he clips this length ball on middle to the long leg boundary. Malinga's pace assists the stroke. Clever shot
length ball with a bit of width, Sharjeel rocks back and cuts behind point. Deep third man is on hand to keep it to a single
and has been carted over midwicket with the least fuss imaginable. Goes down one knee and doesn't mind hitting the offspinner over the leg side because there is no turn. Effective slog sweep
shortish and just outside off as he cuts. Falls just short of a forward-diving point
quicker and fuller on middle as he chips down the track and is struck on the pads
flatter, but full on off stump. Driven to long-off
doesn't mind bowling slower to Shehzad as this is tossed up on leg stump. Worked away into the leg side
flighted on leg stump, brings his bat in front of pad to defend

and claims a wicket straight away! Struck too high on the bat as he went to pull and has given mid-on a very simple catch. Shortish delivery just a touch outside off stump does the trick as Sharjeel falls on his own sword

boy, what a way to get off the mark! It was not a bad ball at all, perhaps just tailing in a bit too much but Hafeez has clipped this right off the middle. Screams away to the backward square leg boundary
shortish and pushes him back in his crease as he defends to mid-on
whipped away past square leg again, this time the fielder hunts it down though. Length ball negotiated smartly
back of a length on off stump forces Hafeez to bring out a straight bat
fullish and outside off, Hafeez is forward and defends
dearie me, that was classy! Bit of width on this good length ball and Shehzad has pounced all over it. Went forward and slices it in front of point and the timing is something to behold
width outside off again as he ventures fuller, driven strongly to the man at cover
shuffles across to meet this good length ball outside off with a whip. Goes down to mid-on for no runs
fullish and on leg stump, Shehzad defends from the crease

slaps it on the up and that had four written all over it until the man in the covers pulls out a full length dive to his right. Stands up tall and just creams it but Chandimal does extremely well. That was travelling
fuller and he leans into another drive on the up, this time only as far as mid-off. Looks like Shehzad has got his eye in
shortish and a touch outside off, Shehzad doesn't bother about moving in line as he guides to point
punished, but for what reason I cannot quite see. Picks up this length ball and short-arm jabs it through midwicket.
back of a length and outside off, defended. But it was off the inside edge though. Played too early
length ball just outside off, punches it into the covers.
he's down the pitch, but Lakmal follows him. Pokes at it and gets an inside edge. Doesn't know where the ball has gone, but Hafeez, at the other end, does and he calls through for a single
fullish on off stump, Hafeez drives to mid-off
short and outside off stump, sets himself up on the back foot and flat bats it over mid-on. Mauled that!
slower ball right on middle, Shehzad adjusts as he keeps it out
low full toss on off stump, Shehzad is not pleased with himself as he can only push this to mid-on
back of a length and outside off, Shezad punches to extra cover

146 kph, finds the gap in the covers. This was overpitched and merited to go to the boundary and that is where he puts this. Leans into the drive and the followthrough went all the way to touch his back and them recoil
full and too straight, Shehzad picks it away and his timing proves a difficult challenge for the deep square leg fielder. But he is able to get a foot on the ball and keep it from going for four
fires his first ball in ODIs down the leg side, Shehzad's dlight doesn't connect and Sanga cannot glove it as well
tossed up outside off, driven solidly to long-off
flighted on middle and leg, Hafeez is forward and defends
comes down the track and nudges it back to the bowler. Has to hurry back to safety as De Silva  feigns to throw
tossed up outside off, lures him forward to block
drags this down short and Hafeez was on the back foot and cuts behind point
looks to play against the turn as this is tossed up on middle and leg. Leading edge takes the ball to cover
short and wide outside off and that has been cut right through point. Magnificent strike from Shehzad as this bounces just in front of the fielder and sneaks through his legs

the keeper leaps up and throws the ball in the air, that was how convinced he was that the edge was taken but the umpire is not even bothered. It was a terrific ball though, jags away off back of a length and lured Shehzad to push away from his body. No edge though
wider outside off and he can cut this away to deep third man
what crisp timing! Came forward and unleashes a square drive that could compete with any shot played today. Malinga in the deep had only a little away to his left to go but that was struck too purely
fullish on middle and leg, pushed to long-on with soft hands to sneak a single
short and wide again as Shehzad rocks back and cuts past point again. Bit more harder to stop this time as he had to dive to his left
flighted down the leg side as he goes to sweep, can't connect but wouldn't be bothered by the result too much. Five wides as the keeper can't get behind it either
works it away behind square leg as this is on a length but on the pads again
nudged to deep square leg as he tries not to give the batsmen any room

first wicket in ODIs and he has fooled Shehzad all ends up! He was plying for turn, but this just keeps going on with the arm. Sneaks between pat and pad and disturbs the stumps. Wonderful strike as his team-mates mob him
flighted on off stump, driven strongly to long-off
goes down the track and pushes to short cover
fired in outside leg, but Hafeez exploits the pace on the ball as he whips it past short fine leg. But the man in the deep pulls out a diving effort to keep it to a couple
good length ball outside off stump, steered past point
dug in quite soft and Maqsood has to use his entire height to try and get on top of this and dab it at his feet. Soft hands ensures an easy single

length ball on off stump, plays all over the shop and he's struck plumb in front! Angled in at him but still he should have presented a straight bat. But he went for the flick through midwicket and pays the price. And that's drinks as well
the Sri Lanka captain greets his counterpart with a short ball outside off. Misbah sways away
another one dug into the middle of the pitch, this one trails down the leg side
back of a length on off stump, defended
stays a touch low, but Misbah is able to flick this fuller delivery off his pads to deep square leg
whipped to backward square leg as this was fired in on leg stump
another arm ball from De Silva as the batsman comes forward to block. Gets a thick inside edge onto pad, but the bowler hasn't spotted it as he goes up in appeal. Not given
nudged down the ground
nicely tossed up outside off as Misbah drives uppishly through extra cover
length ball on off stump, goes back and punches into the covers
drills this to short cover as De Silva goes fuller on off stump
good length ball outside off, Misbah goes back and opens the face but point swoops in on it too quickly
shortish on off stump, Misbah works it to short midwicket
attempted bouncer outside off, Misbah ducks under it. Very flattering to Mathews' pace
length ball on off stump, Misbah waits for it and guides to short third man
he's squared up outside off stump while defended this fullish delivery outside off
ducks back in off a shortish length as Misbah steers it to short third man
flighted on middle and leg, turned away past midwicket
tossed up on off stump, lunges forward to drive but finds short cover
lovely line from De Silva as he lures the batsman to play away from his body. Misbah edges to short third man
clipped to midwicket as this is fuller and fired in quicker
tossed up on middle and leg, driven to long-on
flatter on middle and leg, Maqsood was looking to work it on the leg side but gets it off the outside half of his bat and it dribbles back to the bowler
good length ball, moving in on off stump. Misbah slices it to deep point
back of a length and just outside off. He looks to chop it square on the off side but only gets an inside edge
fullish and just outside off, dabbed to point off the front foot
bouncer on middle and leg, Maqsood is not afraid of pulling the ball and gets a top edge. Doesn't carry to the long leg fielder though
shortish and outside off, shuffles across and steers this behind point
fullish and outside off, Misbah defends with an open face
flighted on middle, pushed to long-off
lovely whip of the wrists sends this tossed up ball on leg stump for deep backward square leg to mop up
length ball on middle and off, worked towards wide long-on
flighted outside off, presses forward to defend
ton of defensive pushes and boom! Slog sweep wide of midwicket. This was tossed up rather wide outside off, which allows all the room he needs to swing away to the boundary
flighted outside off, he goes forward and drives to long-off
length ball just outside off, dabbed behind point
plays for the turn and is beaten! So close to the outside edge too as he was pushing at it outside off.
length ball pushes him back as he blocks square on the off side
hello, he's pulled out the reverse sweep! The bowler has seen him though and drops it a little shorter so that he can only hit it as far as short third man
flighted on middle and leg, defended
good length ball, turning in at him just a touch. Goes back and blocks into the leg side
full and outside off, muscled to mid-off
inside edge as he looks to cut. No danger to the stumps though
stands up tall and steers this back of a length delivery past point
drives off the front foot as this is overpitched, but he can't find the gap in the covers
fullish and wide outside off but Misbah throws his bat at it and scurries through for a single to cover
full on middle and leg, Maqsood clips to midwicket
shortish and on the pads, turned away in front of square leg for a single
flighted on off stump, Maqsood is forward and blocks with an open face through point
this stays quite low! But Misbah is able to bring his bat down in time and send it down to long-on
goes back to defend this length ball on the stumps
flatter and fuller on the stumps, kept out
there was the flighted one and Maqsood manages an inside edge which defeats the keeper. Wanted to thump this through the covers but he'll take what he can get
lured into poking away from the body again as an inside edge manifests. No trouble though as he wanders through to point off his boot
full on off stump, Misbah drives to mid-off
solid drive down the ground and Thisara gets a hand to it. Can't stop the single though, but that was struck quite hard
shortish and picked away off his hips. Possibly the first comfortable shot I've seen Maqsood play today
there's another as he drills this fuller delivery outside off to deep point. Nice stride forward and a lot of conviction in that stroke
waits for this length ball to come to him and tries to steer it behind point, but De Silva is very good in that area, diving to his left
flighted on leg stump, driven back to the bowler
chips down the track and presents a straight bat to this length ball on middle

that is perhaps the worst ball to cause a wicket. Senanayake knows it as he offers a wry, almost apologetic smile to the batsman, who is thoroughly distraught. He had dragged this halfway down the pitch and Maqsood had an age to line up and has carted this right down the throat of deep midwicket. He was scratchy at best, but this is truly a sorry way to go
bit of turn on middle and leg, defended off the back foot
flighted outside off, opens the face as he defends off the front foot
tossed up on leg stump, nudged behind square leg
length ball outside off, blocked to point
back of a length and outside off, steered off an open face
back of a length and outside off stump, defended off the back foot
just short of a good length on middle, Misbah offers a dead bat
slammed over long-on! Length ball mauled over the top as he plants his front foot on leg stump and sends this into orbit
poor shot this time as he plays well away from his body. Beaten on the cut shot
tossed up on middle and off, defended off the front foot
flighted outside off as he presses forward and opens the face towards point
driven through extra cover as this is flighted outside off
goes back and punches this length ball to the sweeper
goes deep in his crease as he sees this short and cuts in front of point
fired in quicker and on a length, Akmal goes back and pushes to long-on
bit of room outside off as he employs a late cut to deep third man
bit too short and bit too wide and Misbah has timed this well. Roll of the wrists gives the cut all the power it needs to reach the backward point boundary
full on middle and leg, nudged away to deep square leg
attempted bouncer, a bit outside off. Akmal evades it
tries to sneak a single behind point, but the fielder was alert to his tactic
strays on the pads and Akmal works it to deep square leg
flighted outside off, driven through the covers
lunges forward and defends this flighted ball on off stump
turns this to midwicket
goes back and punches this length ball back to the bowler
fires this on the pads and Akmal was looking to clip it away. Only gets a pad to it
flighted on middle and leg, defended off the front foot
back of a length and outside off, run down to deep third man
good length ball on off stump, Akmal is forward and pushes back to the bowler

lovely shot from Akmal. It was a short ball but this was put away very nicely as he swivels on the back foot and almost places it perfectly. Deep square leg pulls out a last-minute dive and saves the boundary. Mahela it was
fullish on off stump, defended

terrible length from Mathews and it has been pummeled! It was the offcutter, but he had dragged it down too short. Akmal was on the back foot and plays it with a straight bat over midwicket. Unreal strike, 77m-six
and he wafts outside off the very next ball to be beaten.
flighted on off stump, pushed to long-off
tossed up on middle, Akmal is drawn forwards into a push down the pitch
goes for a slog sweep, but this was fired in a bit too quick for him to get under it
fuller and just outside off, presses forward to drive to short cover
flays this through the covers as he charges down the pitch. Uses an angled bat to place it past the sweeper, but doesn't succeed
slides down leg, but this clips the pad as he was leaving the ball
walks at him and he's nailed it over long-on! Another impressive strike from Akmal as he turns this into an overpitched delivery and lofts through the line of the ball. Lovely balance from Akmal
fullish and on the stumps, defended
walks at him again, but this time Lakmal has spotted the movement and shortens his length. Akmal turns it to midwicket
very full, but this was angled down the leg side and Akmal helps it on its way. Lovely little leg glance from the Pakistan wicketkeeper. Is he begins taking control of this chase?
good length ball on middle, shuffles across to cover his stumps and blocks
too straight and he clips to deep square leg to retain strike
nudged to midwicket, but there is no single there. Misbah sends him back
length ball on middle, worked away to deep square leg
tossed up on leg, comes forward and blocks
concentrates on tucking the batsman up as this is tossed up on leg stump, slides off his pads to short fine leg
leading edge but doesn't carry to the bowler. Akmal is looking for that flick to midwicket but he was playing too early. It lobs up but falls short
shortish and outside off, he rocks back and steers this towards the third man boundary
tossed up on middle and leg, whipped to midwicket
what power! It was nearly the very same ball he defended, but this time he keeps his front leg outside of the way and whips it through midwicket to bring up the fifty partnership
flighted on off stump, brings Misbah forward to defend
takes it on the full as he sweeps to deep square leg. Had to drag it from outside off, but did it well
that was rather full to be swept, but he still manages it and how! They're laying it on the debutant here as Akmal goes down on one-knee and muscles it right through midwlcket
flighted on off, strides forward to defend
flighted on middle and leg, defended
goes back as he waits for this flighted delivery to reach him and turns it away to short fine leg
too much flight there as Akmal punches this low full toss to long-on
flighted on middle and leg, turned away towards midwicket
flighted on leg stump, defended
goes back to this length ball and works it away to deep square leg and that's drinks
he dabs the back of length delivery to the off side for a quick single
length delivery on the stumps, Misbah waits and pushes it to midwicket

it's over! It's the big wicket! No No .. what drama! Sri Lanka think they have the wicket as Misbah pokes as this back of length delivery and is beaten..Sanga takes the catch and lobs it up in celebration.. I heard something.. the fielders heard something.. The umpire, though is unmoved.. What a reprieve! That's a big let off for Misbah and Sri Lanka are visibly peeved. Misbah didn't react at all, but the noise was clear
he comes forward this time and pushes it to cover
waits on the back foot and dabs it to the off side for a quick single

length delivery, the batsman waits on the back foot and defends. Lakmal fields and chucks it to the stumps, still an expression of disappointment on his face.. Some words exchanged between Akmal and Lakmal
he calmly pushes the ball to the right of the bowler for an easy single
spins in and the batsman neatly nudges it behind square on the leg side for another single
this was flatter outside off, but the batsman pushes it to long on with some handy wrist work
tossed up on the pads, the batsman comes forward and flicks it through square leg for another single
once again, the batsman uses his wrists to fetch it from outside off to wide long on.. This time, it's a couple as this was wider than the last shot
more stylish work from Misbah, he gets to his fifty with another wristy flick from outside off to deep midwicket
oh dear, he's bowled it full and on Misbah's pads. That's easy pickings and those powerful wrists do not miss out. Flicked away to the long leg boundary
back of a length on off stump, dabbed away in front of point
length ball on off stump, waits on it and dabs towards point
back of a length and on off stump, Misbah presents a dead bat
steers to point with an open face as this is shortish and outside off
length ball on off stump, defended into the covers
slides on with the arm and seems to have kept low, judging by how Akmal crouches after defended this into the covers

appeal from Sanga for a stumping, but there's not too much hoopla among the Sri Lankans. The tossed up delivery had Akmal lunging forward and is beaten outside the off stump. The keeper does well in whipping the bails off pretty quickly, but the batsman's dragged his foot back just in time. Closer shave than I thought. The Pakistan fans erupt!
punched to long-on as he is now wary that most of his balls aren't getting much turn
flighted on off stump, he prefers to defend off the back foot
massacred over deep midwicket! It was flighted outside off, allowing him to get under it and boy did he tonk it!
quicker delivery on off stump, stays a touch low too. But Misbah's defensive bat is unyielding
slower ball on off stump, Akmal has judged it well and defends
goes for the pull but this is not wide enough to entertain the stroke. Overestimates the bounce
skips down the track and looks to whip it away, gets it off the front pad towards squar leg
eased away through point as this is shortish and outside off
bit of room outside off and Akmal dabs it away to short third man. Slower ball so he didn't have as much pace to work with as normal
rocks back and gets on top of the bounce to slap it away to the sweeper. He's looking ominous now
flighted on middle and leg, turned away towards deep square leg
fullish and directed at the pads, Akmal lunges forward and works it through midwicket
shortish on middle and leg, Misbah whips it away behind square to the man in the deep

lofts it inside out over cover and treats himself to a rather good-looking boundary. Bit of a risk hitting away from the turn, but he had reached the pitch and the open face ensured the ball was always going away from mid-off. Uppishly hit, but perfectly placed
turned away into the square leg region for an easy single
good length ball, worked off the stumps to long leg
overpitched outside off stump, flays it to mid-off. That was powerfully struck
length ball on off stump, defended
length ball, pummeled away and he raises a very important fifty. That was a downright slog, but no one can argue against it's effectiveness

and just so we shut up about him slogging across the line, he slams a straight drive to the bowler's left! Lakmal went for the catch, but pulled out. Good thing, that would have taken his hand on its way to the boundary
heaved over midwicket, Lakmal is being murdered by Akmal! Length ball again, that's the no-no length in this stage of the innings and he learns that the hard way
slower, shorter delivery on off stump. Defended into the midwicket region to retain strike
flighted on off stump, reaches forward to block
one-bounce four over cover! Makes room outside off and carves this flighted ball inside out over the top. Pakistan are racing along here
tossed up on off stump and he was looking to nudge towards midwicket, gets a bit of an edge but it doesn't carry to the bowler
room afforded outside off and he rocks back, almost allows it to pass him before late cutting it to the left of short third man. Misbah pats him on the back as the equation dips below 7 rpo
flighted on leg, turned away towards long leg
flighted on off stump, driven back to the bowler
full toss, swinging further wide of off stump. Akmal flays it behind point but third man is square enough to stop that
wide yorker but Akmal leans into a powerful drive which looked set for another boundary, but Chandimal at short cover dives to his left and stops it

nicked off to the keeper, Lakmal gets Akmal! It was the cross-seamer again, on a length and outside off stump. He was in a roll and just couldn't stop himself as he goes for a massive drive on the up but only manages an outside edge. Punches the air in sweet revenge, but Pakistan have done the hard yards
fullish and just outside off, inside edges it to midwicket as he tries to defend
gets off the mark with a single as this is a fuller length on middle and leg. Pushed to long-on
bit of room outside off as Misbah leans into a square drive. There is a deep point in place
lovely change in pace, but Misbah has spotted it. Walks at him and waits for it before nudging to deep square leg and by the time the fielder rushes forward, they've taken two
slower ball again as he takes a few steps down the track and can only defend this time
on the pads and he flicks it away to deep midwicket
turned away to deep square leg, he's restraining himself for the team's cause here.
shortish and outside off, shuffles across and works it away in front of square leg
tucked away towards deep midwicket as this is on a length and on the stumps
good length ball on leg stump, Afridi pushes it down to long-on
yorker on leg stump, but Misbah is in such good form that he clips it to long leg
back of a length on off stump, Afridi respects it with a back-foot defensive

slapped straight to short cover and Chandimal has held on, despite possible injury to his hand. Ample room outside off and the shot was on, but he cannot find the gap. Chandimal is forced off his feet by the power in this shot and though it went straight at him at stomach-height, this is a blinder!
slides this length ball down leg. Bonus runs for Pakistan
good length ball outside off, defended to point

this time Misbah cannot resist! Holed out at deep square leg! Malinga, you beauty! Two wickets in the over, but neither off particularly good balls. But still he has changed the game! It was a length ball and he swung with all his might, but it sunk right down the throat of the fielder. Taps the incoming batsman on the back to give him some support
back of a length on off stump, nudged to midwicket. Nerves say there is a single on offer, but he gets back to his senses early enough
length ball lofted over mid-off! Bhatti says this is not over yet! Makes some room for himself and powers this over the fielder inside the circle and this is a very quick outfield
back-of-the-hand slower delivery on middle and leg, Bhatti tucks it behind square leg
change of pace again as this is on off stump. Back of the hand slower ball
length ball on middle, stays a touch low but he heaves it away to midwicket
slower and shorter on off stump, Bhatti was off balance as he is deceived. Can only hit to cover
offcutter on the stumps, can only be defended into the covers. They hustle through for a single
opens the face and slices this back of a length delivery to deep point
swings right across the line to a fuller delivery that keeps quite low. Misses the stumps and almost eludes the keeper, but Sanga does well enough
slower ball and it was a bit short outside off too. Gul though can only carve it as far as point. These slower ones are ending up as dot balls more often than not!

leading edge and it is caught at point! Three for Malinga and all he had to do here was keep it tight on middle. Gul was looking for the flick through square leg. Was into the shot too early and skies it towards point where Chaturanga de Silva just about holds on. Oh, Pakistan...
slower offcutter outside off, Bhatti is forward and pushes into the covers to retain strike. It's all on him now
what a shot under pressure! He has smoked it through the covers! Overpitched outside off and he takes his front foot out of the way and unleashes
short ball on middle, clears his front leg and slaps it wide of mid-on. Two for the taking. Bhatti's playing a little gem here
thumped to mid-off as this length ball was just a bit outside off stump. Would have wanted to do much more than that
Ajmal gets into the act and he pulls and evades a desperately diving short midwicket! Pace on the ball seems to be working for Pakistan
goes for the lap sweep, but this was way outside off stump and his eyes were anywhere but on the ball. Still he manages an edge that goes skyward and goes one bounce to the fine leg boundary

edged to the third man boundary and Ajmal has a giant smile on his face, 17 runs off that over and Pakistan are right back in it. It was short, it was wide and it had pace on it. That was all he needed as he threw is bat at it
slower ball from Malinga at 116 kph, Bhatti heaves it in the air to deep square leg. Falls short of the man though

full and straight and he traps Ajmal in front. That's his fourth and this is the best of the lot. An indipping yorker on leg stump sneaks under the Ajmal's flicking bat and that might just have crashed into leg stump
another leg-stump yorker, but this one is eased to deep square leg. Nicely struck too, but Bhatti is happy with the single. He is the more established batsman
low full toss on leg stump and he clips it away to long leg. Oh, he's taking on the fielder's throw and he makes it! Gee, this guy's fast! Two valuable runs

five-for for Malinga as he uproots the off stump. Sri Lanka win! Bhatti was making extravagant room outside off and Malinga saw red. Hurled the yorker at the stumps and beats Bhatti's intended carve over the off side. Terrible ploy considering they still had an over left and Malinga was the main threat.
